section.name: Installation

ul.li: Community files owned by the root account.
Tomcat 5.5.x as the web server, run under the root account, using ports 80 (HTTP) and 443 (HTTPS).
User credentials issued by a community certificate-authority (CA).
A prescribed directory-structure of configuration, database, CA and user-credential files, stored outside the Tomcat installation.

section.p: That arranagement is documented in these pages. Other approaches are possible, at your own risk. Please contact AstroGrid before trying anything unusual; we may be able to help you past the difficulties.
The standard procedure for installation follows.

li.a: Install the web application with its context file.

ol.li: Run the self-tests. (See the main menu in the installed community.)
Register the community in the IVO registry. (See the main menu in the installed community.)

section.p: In this sequence, all the configuration is set before the web application is installed; there is nothing to tune afterwards. If you find that the configuration isn't quite right then the best way to fix it is to remove the web application, edit the configuration files and reinstall the web application.
